snippet: ConAgra Foods agreed to pay $11.2 million to settle a federal charge that the company shipped Peter Pan peanut butter tainted with salmonella, sickening more than 600 people and leading to a huge recall eight years ago.
abstract: ConAgra Foods agrees to pay $11.2 million to settle federal charges that company shipped salmonella-tainted Peter Pan peanut butter from Sylvester, Ga, plant; sum includes $8 million criminal fine, highest ever in American food safety case.
lead_paragraph: ConAgra Foods agreed to pay $11.2 million to settle a federal charge that the company shipped Peter Pan peanut butter tainted with salmonella, sickening more than 600 people and leading to a huge recall eight years ago.

headline.main: Georgia: Conagra Fined $11.2. Million for Salmonella-Tainted Peanut Butter
headline.print_headline: Georgia: ConAgra Fined $11.2 Million for Salmonella-Tainted Peanut Butter
